title: Ohms law - resistivity - resistors same volume

content.description: Two resistors, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are made from the same conductive material. Both resistors are cylindrical and have the same volume, but the length of Resistor <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi> </math> is twice the length of Resistor <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>. Resistor <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is connected to a battery and the current in the resistor is <math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the current in Resistor <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi> </math> when it is connected to the same battery?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
